31#include <sys/cdefs.h>
32__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: i915_gem_stolen.c,v 1.11 2018/09/13 08:25:55 mrg Exp $");
33
34#include <linux/printk.h>
35#include <linux/err.h>
36#include <drm/drmP.h>
37#include <drm/i915_drm.h>
38#include "i915_drv.h"
39
40#define KB(x) ((x) * 1024)
41#define MB(x) (KB(x) * 1024)
42
43/*
44 * The BIOS typically reserves some of the system's memory for the exclusive
45 * use of the integrated graphics. This memory is no longer available for
46 * use by the OS and so the user finds that his system has less memory
47 * available than he put in. We refer to this memory as stolen.
48 *
49 * The BIOS will allocate its framebuffer from the stolen memory. Our
50 * goal is try to reuse that object for our own fbcon which must always
51 * be available for panics. Anything else we can reuse the stolen memory
52 * for is a boon.
53 */
54
55int i915_gem_stolen_insert_node_in_range(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
56 struct drm_mm_node *node, u64 size,
57 unsigned alignment, u64 start, u64 end)
58{
59 int ret;
60
61 if (!drm_mm_initialized(&dev_priv->mm.stolen))
62 return -ENODEV;
63
64 /* See the comment at the drm_mm_init() call for more about this check.
65 * WaSkipStolenMemoryFirstPage:bdw,chv (incomplete) */
66 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen == 8 && start < 4096)
67 start = 4096;
68
69 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
70 ret = drm_mm_insert_node_in_range(&dev_priv->mm.stolen, node, size,
71 alignment, start, end,
72 DRM_MM_SEARCH_DEFAULT);
73 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
74
75 return ret;
76}
77
78int i915_gem_stolen_insert_node(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
79 struct drm_mm_node *node, u64 size,
80 unsigned alignment)
81{
82 return i915_gem_stolen_insert_node_in_range(dev_priv, node, size,
83 alignment, 0,
84 dev_priv->gtt.stolen_usable_size);
85}
86
87void i915_gem_stolen_remove_node(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
88 struct drm_mm_node *node)
89{
90 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
91 drm_mm_remove_node(node);
92 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
93}
94
95static unsigned long i915_stolen_to_physical(struct drm_device *dev)
96{
97 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
98#ifndef __NetBSD__
99 struct resource *r;
100#endif
101 u32 base;
102
103 /* Almost universally we can find the Graphics Base of Stolen Memory
104 * at offset 0x5c in the igfx configuration space. On a few (desktop)
105 * machines this is also mirrored in the bridge device at different
106 * locations, or in the MCHBAR.
107 *
108 * On 865 we just check the TOUD register.
109 *
110 * On 830/845/85x the stolen memory base isn't available in any
111 * register. We need to calculate it as TOM-TSEG_SIZE-stolen_size.
112 *
113 */
114 base = 0;
115 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 3) {
116 /* Read Graphics Base of Stolen Memory directly */
117 pci_read_config_dword(dev->pdev, 0x5c, &base);
118 base &= ~((1<<20) - 1);
119 } else if (IS_I865G(dev)) {
120 u32 tseg_size = 0;
121 u16 toud = 0;
122 u8 tmp;
123
124 pci_bus_read_config_byte(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0),
125 I845_ESMRAMC, &tmp);
126
127 if (tmp & TSEG_ENABLE) {
128 switch (tmp & I845_TSEG_SIZE_MASK) {
129 case I845_TSEG_SIZE_512K:
130 tseg_size = KB(512);
131 break;
132 case I845_TSEG_SIZE_1M:
133 tseg_size = MB(1);
134 break;
135 }
136 }
137
138 pci_bus_read_config_word(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0),
139 I865_TOUD, &toud);
140
141 base = (toud << 16) + tseg_size;
142 } else if (IS_I85X(dev)) {
143 u32 tseg_size = 0;
144 u32 tom;
145 u8 tmp;
146
147 pci_bus_read_config_byte(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0),
148 I85X_ESMRAMC, &tmp);
149
150 if (tmp & TSEG_ENABLE)
151 tseg_size = MB(1);
152
153 pci_bus_read_config_byte(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 1),
154 I85X_DRB3, &tmp);
155 tom = tmp * MB(32);
156
157 base = tom - tseg_size - dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size;
158 } else if (IS_845G(dev)) {
159 u32 tseg_size = 0;
160 u32 tom;
161 u8 tmp;
162
163 pci_bus_read_config_byte(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0),
164 I845_ESMRAMC, &tmp);
165
166 if (tmp & TSEG_ENABLE) {
167 switch (tmp & I845_TSEG_SIZE_MASK) {
168 case I845_TSEG_SIZE_512K:
169 tseg_size = KB(512);
170 break;
171 case I845_TSEG_SIZE_1M:
172 tseg_size = MB(1);
173 break;
174 }
175 }
176
177 pci_bus_read_config_byte(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0),
178 I830_DRB3, &tmp);
179 tom = tmp * MB(32);
180
181 base = tom - tseg_size - dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size;
182 } else if (IS_I830(dev)) {
183 u32 tseg_size = 0;
184 u32 tom;
185 u8 tmp;
186
187 pci_bus_read_config_byte(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0),
188 I830_ESMRAMC, &tmp);
189
190 if (tmp & TSEG_ENABLE) {
191 if (tmp & I830_TSEG_SIZE_1M)
192 tseg_size = MB(1);
193 else
194 tseg_size = KB(512);
195 }
196
197 pci_bus_read_config_byte(dev->pdev->bus, PCI_DEVFN(0, 0),
198 I830_DRB3, &tmp);
199 tom = tmp * MB(32);
200
201 base = tom - tseg_size - dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size;
202 }
203
204 if (base == 0)
205 return 0;
206
207 /* make sure we don't clobber the GTT if it's within stolen memory */
208 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen <= 4 && !IS_G33(dev) && !IS_G4X(dev)) {
209 struct {
210 u32 start, end;
211 } stolen[2] = {
212 { .start = base, .end = base + dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size, },
213 { .start = base, .end = base + dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size, },
214 };
215 u64 gtt_start, gtt_end;
216
217 gtt_start = I915_READ(PGTBL_CTL);
218 if (IS_GEN4(dev))
219 gtt_start = (gtt_start & PGTBL_ADDRESS_LO_MASK) |
220 (gtt_start & PGTBL_ADDRESS_HI_MASK) << 28;
221 else
222 gtt_start &= PGTBL_ADDRESS_LO_MASK;
223 gtt_end = gtt_start + gtt_total_entries(dev_priv->gtt) * 4;
224
225 if (gtt_start >= stolen[0].start && gtt_start < stolen[0].end)
226 stolen[0].end = gtt_start;
227 if (gtt_end > stolen[1].start && gtt_end <= stolen[1].end)
228 stolen[1].start = gtt_end;
229
230 /* pick the larger of the two chunks */
231 if (stolen[0].end - stolen[0].start >
232 stolen[1].end - stolen[1].start) {
233 base = stolen[0].start;
234 dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size = stolen[0].end - stolen[0].start;
235 } else {
236 base = stolen[1].start;
237 dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size = stolen[1].end - stolen[1].start;
238 }
239
240 if (stolen[0].start != stolen[1].start ||
241 stolen[0].end != stolen[1].end) {
242 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("GTT within stolen memory at 0x%llx-0x%llx\n",
243 (unsigned long long) gtt_start,
244 (unsigned long long) gtt_end - 1);
245 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Stolen memory adjusted to 0x%x-0x%x\n",
246 base, base + (u32) dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size - 1);
247 }
248 }
249
250
251#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX */
252 /* Verify that nothing else uses this physical address. Stolen
253 * memory should be reserved by the BIOS and hidden from the
254 * kernel. So if the region is already marked as busy, something
255 * is seriously wrong.
256 */
257 r = devm_request_mem_region(dev->dev, base, dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size,
258 "Graphics Stolen Memory");
259 if (r == NULL) {
260 /*
261 * One more attempt but this time requesting region from
262 * base + 1, as we have seen that this resolves the region
263 * conflict with the PCI Bus.
264 * This is a BIOS w/a: Some BIOS wrap stolen in the root
265 * PCI bus, but have an off-by-one error. Hence retry the
266 * reservation starting from 1 instead of 0.
267 */
268 r = devm_request_mem_region(dev->dev, base + 1,
269 dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size - 1,
270 "Graphics Stolen Memory");
271 /*
272 * GEN3 firmware likes to smash pci bridges into the stolen
273 * range. Apparently this works.
274 */
275 if (r == NULL && !IS_GEN3(dev)) {
276 DRM_ERROR("conflict detected with stolen region: [0x%08x - 0x%08x]\n",
277 base, base + (uint32_t)dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size);
278 base = 0;
279 }
280 }
281#endif
282
283 return base;
284}
285
286void i915_gem_cleanup_stolen(struct drm_device *dev)
287{
288 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
289
290 if (!drm_mm_initialized(&dev_priv->mm.stolen))
291 return;
292
293#ifdef __NetBSD__
294 linux_mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
295#else
296 mutex_destroy(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
297#endif
298
299 drm_mm_takedown(&dev_priv->mm.stolen);
300}
301
302static void g4x_get_stolen_reserved(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
303 unsigned long *base, unsigned long *size)
304{
305 uint32_t reg_val = I915_READ(IS_GM45(dev_priv) ?
306 CTG_STOLEN_RESERVED :
307 ELK_STOLEN_RESERVED);
308 unsigned long stolen_top = dev_priv->mm.stolen_base +
309 dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size;
310
311 *base = (reg_val & G4X_STOLEN_RESERVED_ADDR2_MASK) << 16;
312
313 WARN_ON((reg_val & G4X_STOLEN_RESERVED_ADDR1_MASK) < *base);
314
315 /* On these platforms, the register doesn't have a size field, so the
316 * size is the distance between the base and the top of the stolen
317 * memory. We also have the genuine case where base is zero and there's
318 * nothing reserved. */
319 if (*base == 0)
320 *size = 0;
321 else
322 *size = stolen_top - *base;
323}
324
325static void gen6_get_stolen_reserved(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
326 unsigned long *base, unsigned long *size)
327{
328 uint32_t reg_val = I915_READ(GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED);
329
330 *base = reg_val & GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_ADDR_MASK;
331
332 switch (reg_val & GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_SIZE_MASK) {
333 case GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_1M:
334 *size = 1024 * 1024;
335 break;
336 case GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_512K:
337 *size = 512 * 1024;
338 break;
339 case GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_256K:
340 *size = 256 * 1024;
341 break;
342 case GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_128K:
343 *size = 128 * 1024;
344 break;
345 default:
346 *size = 1024 * 1024;
347 MISSING_CASE(reg_val & GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_SIZE_MASK);
348 }
349}
350
351static void gen7_get_stolen_reserved(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
352 unsigned long *base, unsigned long *size)
353{
354 uint32_t reg_val = I915_READ(GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED);
355
356 *base = reg_val & GEN7_STOLEN_RESERVED_ADDR_MASK;
357
358 switch (reg_val & GEN7_STOLEN_RESERVED_SIZE_MASK) {
359 case GEN7_STOLEN_RESERVED_1M:
360 *size = 1024 * 1024;
361 break;
362 case GEN7_STOLEN_RESERVED_256K:
363 *size = 256 * 1024;
364 break;
365 default:
366 *size = 1024 * 1024;
367 MISSING_CASE(reg_val & GEN7_STOLEN_RESERVED_SIZE_MASK);
368 }
369}
370
371static void gen8_get_stolen_reserved(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
372 unsigned long *base, unsigned long *size)
373{
374 uint32_t reg_val = I915_READ(GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED);
375
376 *base = reg_val & GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_ADDR_MASK;
377
378 switch (reg_val & GEN8_STOLEN_RESERVED_SIZE_MASK) {
379 case GEN8_STOLEN_RESERVED_1M:
380 *size = 1024 * 1024;
381 break;
382 case GEN8_STOLEN_RESERVED_2M:
383 *size = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
384 break;
385 case GEN8_STOLEN_RESERVED_4M:
386 *size = 4 * 1024 * 1024;
387 break;
388 case GEN8_STOLEN_RESERVED_8M:
389 *size = 8 * 1024 * 1024;
390 break;
391 default:
392 *size = 8 * 1024 * 1024;
393 MISSING_CASE(reg_val & GEN8_STOLEN_RESERVED_SIZE_MASK);
394 }
395}
396
397static void bdw_get_stolen_reserved(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
398 unsigned long *base, unsigned long *size)
399{
400 uint32_t reg_val = I915_READ(GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED);
401 unsigned long stolen_top;
402
403 stolen_top = dev_priv->mm.stolen_base + dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size;
404
405 *base = reg_val & GEN6_STOLEN_RESERVED_ADDR_MASK;
406
407 /* On these platforms, the register doesn't have a size field, so the
408 * size is the distance between the base and the top of the stolen
409 * memory. We also have the genuine case where base is zero and there's
410 * nothing reserved. */
411 if (*base == 0)
412 *size = 0;
413 else
414 *size = stolen_top - *base;
415}
416
417int i915_gem_init_stolen(struct drm_device *dev)
418{
419 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
420 unsigned long reserved_total, reserved_base = 0, reserved_size;
421 unsigned long stolen_top;
422
423#ifdef __NetBSD__
424 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
425#else
426 mutex_init(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
427#endif
428
429#ifdef CONFIG_INTEL_IOMMU
430 if (intel_iommu_gfx_mapped && INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 8) {
431 DRM_INFO("DMAR active, disabling use of stolen memory\n");
432 return 0;
433 }
434#endif
435
436 if (dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size == 0)
437 return 0;
438
439 dev_priv->mm.stolen_base = i915_stolen_to_physical(dev);
440 if (dev_priv->mm.stolen_base == 0)
441 return 0;
442
443 stolen_top = dev_priv->mm.stolen_base + dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size;
444
445 switch (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen) {
446 case 2:
447 case 3:
448 break;
449 case 4:
450 if (IS_G4X(dev))
451 g4x_get_stolen_reserved(dev_priv, &reserved_base,
452 &reserved_size);
453 break;
454 case 5:
455 /* Assume the gen6 maximum for the older platforms. */
456 reserved_size = 1024 * 1024;
457 reserved_base = stolen_top - reserved_size;
458 break;
459 case 6:
460 gen6_get_stolen_reserved(dev_priv, &reserved_base,
461 &reserved_size);
462 break;
463 case 7:
464 gen7_get_stolen_reserved(dev_priv, &reserved_base,
465 &reserved_size);
466 break;
467 default:
468 if (IS_BROADWELL(dev_priv) ||
469 IS_SKYLAKE(dev_priv) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev))
470 bdw_get_stolen_reserved(dev_priv, &reserved_base,
471 &reserved_size);
472 else
473 gen8_get_stolen_reserved(dev_priv, &reserved_base,
474 &reserved_size);
475 break;
476 }
477
478 /* It is possible for the reserved base to be zero, but the register
479 * field for size doesn't have a zero option. */
480 if (reserved_base == 0) {
481 reserved_size = 0;
482 reserved_base = stolen_top;
483 }
484
485 if (reserved_base < dev_priv->mm.stolen_base ||
486 reserved_base + reserved_size > stolen_top) {
487 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Stolen reserved area [0x%08lx - 0x%08lx] outside stolen memory [0x%08lx - 0x%08lx]\n",
488 reserved_base, reserved_base + reserved_size,
489 dev_priv->mm.stolen_base, stolen_top);
490 return 0;
491 }
492
493 /* It is possible for the reserved area to end before the end of stolen
494 * memory, so just consider the start. */
495 reserved_total = stolen_top - reserved_base;
496
497 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Memory reserved for graphics device: %zuK, usable: %luK\n",
498 dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size >> 10,
499 (dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size - reserved_total) >> 10);
500
501 dev_priv->gtt.stolen_usable_size = dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size -
502 reserved_total;
503
504 /*
505 * Basic memrange allocator for stolen space.
506 *
507 * TODO: Notice that some platforms require us to not use the first page
508 * of the stolen memory but their BIOSes may still put the framebuffer
509 * on the first page. So we don't reserve this page for now because of
510 * that. Our current solution is to just prevent new nodes from being
511 * inserted on the first page - see the check we have at
512 * i915_gem_stolen_insert_node_in_range(). We may want to fix the fbcon
513 * problem later.
514 */
515 drm_mm_init(&dev_priv->mm.stolen, 0, dev_priv->gtt.stolen_usable_size);
516
517 return 0;
518}
519
520#ifdef __NetBSD__
521static bus_dmamap_t
522i915_pages_create_for_stolen(struct drm_device *dev, u32 offset, u32 size)
523{
524 struct drm_i915_private *const dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
525 bus_dmamap_t dmamap = NULL;
526 bus_dma_segment_t *seg;
527 int nseg, i;
528 int ret;
529
530 KASSERT((size % PAGE_SIZE) == 0);
531 nseg = size / PAGE_SIZE;
532 seg = kmem_alloc(nseg * sizeof(seg[0]), KM_SLEEP);
533
534 /*
535 * x86 bus_dmamap_load_raw fails to respect the maxsegsz we
536 * pass to bus_dmamap_create, so we have to create page-sized
537 * segments to begin with.
538 */
539 for (i = 0; i < nseg; i++) {
540 seg[i].ds_addr = (bus_addr_t)dev_priv->mm.stolen_base +
541 offset + i*PAGE_SIZE;
542 seg[i].ds_len = PAGE_SIZE;
543 }
544
545 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
546 ret = -bus_dmamap_create(dev->dmat, size, nseg, PAGE_SIZE,
547 0, BUS_DMA_WAITOK, &dmamap);
548 if (ret) {
549 DRM_ERROR("failed to create DMA map for stolen object: %d\n",
550 ret);
551fail0: dmamap = NULL; /* paranoia */
552 goto out;
553 }
554
555 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Liux */
556 ret = -bus_dmamap_load_raw(dev->dmat, dmamap, seg, nseg, size,
557 BUS_DMA_WAITOK);
558 if (ret) {
559 DRM_ERROR("failed to load DMA map for stolen object: %d\n",
560 ret);
561fail1: __unused
562 bus_dmamap_destroy(dev->dmat, dmamap);
563 goto fail0;
564 }
565
566out: kmem_free(seg, nseg*sizeof(seg[0]));
567 return dmamap;
568}
569#else
570static struct sg_table *
571i915_pages_create_for_stolen(struct drm_device *dev,
572 u32 offset, u32 size)
573{
574 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
575 struct sg_table *st;
576 struct scatterlist *sg;
577
578 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("offset=0x%x, size=%d\n", offset, size);
579 BUG_ON(offset > dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size - size);
580
581 /* We hide that we have no struct page backing our stolen object
582 * by wrapping the contiguous physical allocation with a fake
583 * dma mapping in a single scatterlist.
584 */
585
586 st = kmalloc(sizeof(*st), GFP_KERNEL);
587 if (st == NULL)
588 return NULL;
589
590 if (sg_alloc_table(st, 1, GFP_KERNEL)) {
591 kfree(st);
592 return NULL;
593 }
594
595 sg = st->sgl;
596 sg->offset = 0;
597 sg->length = size;
598
599 sg_dma_address(sg) = (dma_addr_t)dev_priv->mm.stolen_base + offset;
600 sg_dma_len(sg) = size;
601
602 return st;
603}
604#endif
605
606static int i915_gem_object_get_pages_stolen(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
607{
608 BUG();
609 return -EINVAL;
610}
611
612static void i915_gem_object_put_pages_stolen(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
613{
614 /* Should only be called during free */
615#ifdef __NetBSD__
616 bus_dmamap_unload(obj->base.dev->dmat, obj->pages);
617 bus_dmamap_destroy(obj->base.dev->dmat, obj->pages);
618#else
619 sg_free_table(obj->pages);
620 kfree(obj->pages);
621#endif
622}
623
624
625static void
626i915_gem_object_release_stolen(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
627{
628 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = obj->base.dev->dev_private;
629
630 if (obj->stolen) {
631 i915_gem_stolen_remove_node(dev_priv, obj->stolen);
632 kfree(obj->stolen);
633 obj->stolen = NULL;
634 }
635}
636static const struct drm_i915_gem_object_ops i915_gem_object_stolen_ops = {
637 .get_pages = i915_gem_object_get_pages_stolen,
638 .put_pages = i915_gem_object_put_pages_stolen,
639 .release = i915_gem_object_release_stolen,
640};
641
642static struct drm_i915_gem_object *
643_i915_gem_object_create_stolen(struct drm_device *dev,
644 struct drm_mm_node *stolen)
645{
646 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
647
648 obj = i915_gem_object_alloc(dev);
649 if (obj == NULL)
650 return NULL;
651
652 drm_gem_private_object_init(dev, &obj->base, stolen->size);
653 i915_gem_object_init(obj, &i915_gem_object_stolen_ops);
654
655 obj->pages = i915_pages_create_for_stolen(dev,
656 stolen->start, stolen->size);
657 if (obj->pages == NULL)
658 goto cleanup;
659
660 i915_gem_object_pin_pages(obj);
661 obj->stolen = stolen;
662
663 obj->base.read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU | I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT;
664 obj->cache_level = HAS_LLC(dev) ? I915_CACHE_LLC : I915_CACHE_NONE;
665
666 return obj;
667
668cleanup:
669 i915_gem_object_free(obj);
670 return NULL;
671}
672
673struct drm_i915_gem_object *
674i915_gem_object_create_stolen(struct drm_device *dev, u32 size)
675{
676 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
677 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
678 struct drm_mm_node *stolen;
679 int ret;
680
681 if (!drm_mm_initialized(&dev_priv->mm.stolen))
682 return NULL;
683
684 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("creating stolen object: size=%x\n", size);
685 if (size == 0)
686 return NULL;
687
688 stolen = kzalloc(sizeof(*stolen), GFP_KERNEL);
689 if (!stolen)
690 return NULL;
691
692 ret = i915_gem_stolen_insert_node(dev_priv, stolen, size, 4096);
693 if (ret) {
694 kfree(stolen);
695 return NULL;
696 }
697
698 obj = _i915_gem_object_create_stolen(dev, stolen);
699 if (obj)
700 return obj;
701
702 i915_gem_stolen_remove_node(dev_priv, stolen);
703 kfree(stolen);
704 return NULL;
705}
706
707struct drm_i915_gem_object *
708i915_gem_object_create_stolen_for_preallocated(struct drm_device *dev,
709 u32 stolen_offset,
710 u32 gtt_offset,
711 u32 size)
712{
713 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
714 struct i915_address_space *ggtt = &dev_priv->gtt.base;
715 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
716 struct drm_mm_node *stolen;
717 struct i915_vma *vma;
718 int ret;
719
720 if (!drm_mm_initialized(&dev_priv->mm.stolen))
721 return NULL;
722
723 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("creating preallocated stolen object: stolen_offset=%x, gtt_offset=%x, size=%x\n",
724 stolen_offset, gtt_offset, size);
725
726 /* KISS and expect everything to be page-aligned */
727 if (WARN_ON(size == 0) || WARN_ON(size & 4095) ||
728 WARN_ON(stolen_offset & 4095))
729 return NULL;
730
731 stolen = kzalloc(sizeof(*stolen), GFP_KERNEL);
732 if (!stolen)
733 return NULL;
734
735 stolen->start = stolen_offset;
736 stolen->size = size;
737 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
738 ret = drm_mm_reserve_node(&dev_priv->mm.stolen, stolen);
739 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->mm.stolen_lock);
740 if (ret) {
741 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("failed to allocate stolen space\n");
742 kfree(stolen);
743 return NULL;
744 }
745
746 obj = _i915_gem_object_create_stolen(dev, stolen);
747 if (obj == NULL) {
748 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("failed to allocate stolen object\n");
749 i915_gem_stolen_remove_node(dev_priv, stolen);
750 kfree(stolen);
751 return NULL;
752 }
753
754 /* Some objects just need physical mem from stolen space */
755 if (gtt_offset == I915_GTT_OFFSET_NONE)
756 return obj;
757
758 vma = i915_gem_obj_lookup_or_create_vma(obj, ggtt);
759 if (IS_ERR(vma)) {
760 ret = PTR_ERR(vma);
761 goto err;
762 }
763
764 /* To simplify the initialisation sequence between KMS and GTT,
765 * we allow construction of the stolen object prior to
766 * setting up the GTT space. The actual reservation will occur
767 * later.
768 */
769 vma->node.start = gtt_offset;
770 vma->node.size = size;
771 if (drm_mm_initialized(&ggtt->mm)) {
772 ret = drm_mm_reserve_node(&ggtt->mm, &vma->node);
773 if (ret) {
774 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("failed to allocate stolen GTT space\n");
775 goto err;
776 }
777
778 vma->bound |= GLOBAL_BIND;
779 __i915_vma_set_map_and_fenceable(vma);
780 list_add_tail(&vma->mm_list, &ggtt->inactive_list);
781 }
782
783 list_add_tail(&obj->global_list, &dev_priv->mm.bound_list);
784 i915_gem_object_pin_pages(obj);
785
786 return obj;
787
788err:
789 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
790 return NULL;
791}
